So many of you people sound like complete morons. Obviously, blowing up a school bus or a wedding is evil. There is *no* justification for that, ever! So it isn't about which "side" was more evil or did more of this. It's about the individuals who chose to do something so evil that they became living monster, living, human trash. Targeting soldiers in a way is one thing, targeting innocents, deliberately, and in the name of your cause or God, makes you a devil and your cause less than worthless.

A-8
V-8

Movie:
The idea of making your central character a former member of the IRA is not original or even controversial; frankly, it's the least of this movie's problems. It's a very average, low budget action flick with all of the standard cliches and by-the-numbers plot.  There are a few tense moments (Chinese food anyone?) but Crawford's acting is a too Hollywood (ie: shit) and the script is too feeble to maintain any sense of threat or plausibility. Not even Keith David (Platoon, There's Something About Mary) can improve things although, his scenes are probably the best.
st0gey's comment above is fair. A/V is good but the movie is so-so at best. There's a lot of other stuff you could be watching instead of this.
